elements.title: Kortnei Johnson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kortnei Johnson (pictured) became a seven-time state sprinting champion for the University Interscholastic League despite training on grass and cement?

elements.title: German Mission House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that over the course of several decades, the missionaries of New Zealand's German Mission House failed to convert a single person?

elements.title: Great Genna Martyrdom (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that all 55 people killed during the Great Genna Martyrdom in 1622 were beatified by Pope Pius IX more than two hundred years later?

elements.title: Jeffrey Veregge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that S'Klallam artist Jeffrey Veregge's "Salish Geek" style blended traditional formline art techniques with bright colors and pop culture references?

elements.title: Ōsakishimojima (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the daimyo of Kumamoto is said to have spent a thousand gold pieces in one night at an Ōsakishimojima teahouse?

elements.title: C. J. Hanson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2024, C. J. Hanson became the first player from his school to be chosen in the NFL draft since 1989?

elements.title: a Catholic church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Chinese Red Army housed its political directorate in a Catholic church in 1935?

elements.title: algebra on tree seeds in order to tell the future (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that people in Madagascar perform algebra on tree seeds in order to tell the future?
